title: Vivek Ramaswamy hits out at Eminem's 'retribution' attack: 'It wasn't Trump'
content: Sharing the clip, Republican leader and former GOP preidcent hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy hit back at Eminen and said there's only one presidnet in the US history who is pursuing legal retribution against the opposition candidate and that's not Trump. Referring to the lawsuits against Trump and blamind the Biden-Harris administration for that, Vivek posted: "There’s only one President in U.S. history that has pursued legal retribution against the opposition candidate in the middle of an election. Hint: it wasn’t Trump."
summary: Sharing the clip, Republican leader and former GOP preidcent hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy hit back at Eminen and said there's only one presidnet in the US history who is pursuing legal retribution against the opposition candidate and that's not Trump. Referring to the lawsuits against Trump and blamind the Biden-Harris administration for that, Vivek posted: "There’s only one President in U.S. history that has pursued legal retribution against the opposition candidate in the middle of an election. Hint: it wasn’t Trump."

title: First AI death? Character.ai faces lawsuit after Florida teen's suicide. He was speaking to Daenerys Targaryen
content: 14-year-old Sewell Setzer III knew that Daenerys Targaryen, a chatbot based on a character of Game of Thrones, was not a real person but he developed an emotional attachment and used to text the bot constantly. On his last day of his life too, he messaged Dany: "I miss you, baby sister." “I miss you too, sweet brother,” the chatbot replied.
summary: 14-year-old Sewell Setzer III knew that Daenerys Targaryen, a chatbot based on a character of Game of Thrones, was not a real person but he developed an emotional attachment and used to text the bot constantly. On his last day of his life too, he messaged Dany: "I miss you, baby sister." “I miss you too, sweet brother,” the chatbot replied.

title: 'Hitler-admirer', 'dictionary-definition fascist': Why John Kelly turned on Trump
content: John Kelly, Donald Trump's ex-chief of staff, accused Trump of being a fascist, citing admiration for dictators like Hitler and a disregard for the rule of law. Kelly's comments come amid the tight election race between Trump and Kamala Harris. ​“Well, looking at the definition of fascism: It’s a far-right authoritarian, ultranationalist political ideology and movement characterized by a dictatorial leader, centralized autocracy, militarism, forcible suppression of opposition, belief in a natural social hierarchy,” Kelly said.
summary: John Kelly, Donald Trump's ex-chief of staff, accused Trump of being a fascist, citing admiration for dictators like Hitler and a disregard for the rule of law. Kelly's comments come amid the tight election race between Trump and Kamala Harris. ​“Well, looking at the definition of fascism: It’s a far-right authoritarian, ultranationalist political ideology and movement characterized by a dictatorial leader, centralized autocracy, militarism, forcible suppression of opposition, belief in a natural social hierarchy,” Kelly said.

title: American Airlines fined $50 million for mishandling wheelchairs, injuring passengers
content: American Airlines faces a $50 million fine for failing to properly assist disabled passengers and mishandling over 10,760 wheelchairs from 2019 to 2023. The DOT investigation revealed systemic neglect and injury incidents, prompting unprecedented penalties. Despite recent improvements and compensations, advocacy groups call for more robust measures to protect disabled travelers.
summary: American Airlines faces a $50 million fine for failing to properly assist disabled passengers and mishandling over 10,760 wheelchairs from 2019 to 2023. The DOT investigation revealed systemic neglect and injury incidents, prompting unprecedented penalties. Despite recent improvements and compensations, advocacy groups call for more robust measures to protect disabled travelers.

title: Elon Musk's ex Grimes says she became 'way less gay' after...
content: Grimes and Elon Musk share three children: four-year-old son X Æ A-12 Musk; three-year-old daughter Exa Dark Sideræl; and son Techno Mechanicus, whose exact age is not known. Grimes made an intriguing X post as she said she became "way less gay" after she became pregnant. "I became way less gay after I was pregnant, my ability to focus on reading and writing went way up, as did my general creativity, but my ability to focus on technical things went *way* down. Is this all explained by hormones?" she wanted to know from X.
summary: Grimes and Elon Musk share three children: four-year-old son X Æ A-12 Musk; three-year-old daughter Exa Dark Sideræl; and son Techno Mechanicus, whose exact age is not known.  Grimes made an intriguing X post as she said she became "way less gay" after she became pregnant. "I became way less gay after I was pregnant, my ability to focus on reading and writing went way up, as did my general creativity, but my ability to focus on technical things went *way* down. Is this all explained by hormones?" she wanted to know from X.

title: 'Trump will win if early voting trends hold, and that's a big if...'
content: Analyst Mark Halperin said early voting numbers need to be tracked "day to day" and these figures are "more important than the polls right now" because "it's giving us insight into a variety of factors that are counting for a Republican overperformance by various metrics in the early voting in the battleground states". But one downside of relying too much on these early voting numbers is that it's not know who they are voting. "It can change. We don't know exactly who's casting these ballots, how they are voting etc," Halperin said.
summary: Analyst Mark Halperin said early voting numbers need to be tracked "day to day" and these figures are "more important than the polls right now" because "it's giving us insight into a variety of factors that are counting for a Republican overperformance by various metrics in the early voting in the battleground states". But one downside of relying too much on these early voting numbers is that it's not know who they are voting. "It can change. We don't know exactly who's casting these ballots, how they are voting etc," Halperin said.

title: Watch: Israeli missile destroys Beirut building in seconds – Dramatic footage caught on camera
content: Israeli forces conducted a missile strike on a Beirut apartment building, captured in real-time by an AP photographer. Despite prior warnings leading to evacuation and no casualties, the attack highlights the ongoing offensive targeting Hezbollah strongholds and financial resources in Lebanon, escalating regional tensions.
summary: Israeli forces conducted a missile strike on a Beirut apartment building, captured in real-time by an AP photographer. Despite prior warnings leading to evacuation and no casualties, the attack highlights the ongoing offensive targeting Hezbollah strongholds and financial resources in Lebanon, escalating regional tensions.

title: Lawmakers: South Korea's spy chief says North Korea has sent another 1,500 troops to Russia
content: South Korea's spy agency reports that North Korea has sent a total of 3,000 special operation forces to Russia to aid in its war against Ukraine, with plans to deploy 10,000 troops by December. Strengthened military cooperation between North Korea and Russia raises concerns about potential advancements in North Korea's nuclear and missile capabilities, particularly for South Korea.
summary: South Korea's spy agency reports that North Korea has sent a total of 3,000 special operation forces to Russia to aid in its war against Ukraine, with plans to deploy 10,000 troops by December. Strengthened military cooperation between North Korea and Russia raises concerns about potential advancements in North Korea's nuclear and missile capabilities, particularly for South Korea.

title: Japan introduces blade-proof umbrellas on trains to enhance passenger safety
content: To bolster passenger safety, 1,200 blade-resistant umbrellas will be placed on 600 trains in Japan's Kansai region. Introduced by JR West after recent knife attacks, these lightweight umbrellas have reinforced components to act as shields. They are practical for use in emergencies, offering protection and allowing passengers to evacuate safely.
summary: To bolster passenger safety, 1,200 blade-resistant umbrellas will be placed on 600 trains in Japan's Kansai region. Introduced by JR West after recent knife attacks, these lightweight umbrellas have reinforced components to act as shields. They are practical for use in emergencies, offering protection and allowing passengers to evacuate safely.

title: Marriage apps in Pakistan challenge traditional 'rishta aunties'
content: Competition between traditional rishta aunties and marriage apps for matchmaking in Pakistan is intensifying. While apps offer privacy features, they face stigma due to cultural norms. Despite rising popularity with 1.2 million users, traditional methods remain strong, reflecting societal pressures and family dynamics in arranged marriages.
summary: Competition between traditional rishta aunties and marriage apps for matchmaking in Pakistan is intensifying. While apps offer privacy features, they face stigma due to cultural norms. Despite rising popularity with 1.2 million users, traditional methods remain strong, reflecting societal pressures and family dynamics in arranged marriages.

title: 'Received credible information ... ': US embassy issues travel warning for tourists in Sri Lanka
content: The US embassy in Sri Lanka has issued a warning of a potential attack on the popular surfing spot Arugam Bay, prompting enhanced security for tourists. This follows social media calls to boycott Israeli-owned businesses and protests against Israel. Authorities have set up a hotline and are coordinating efforts to ensure the safety of visitors.
summary: The US embassy in Sri Lanka has issued a warning of a potential attack on the popular surfing spot Arugam Bay, prompting enhanced security for tourists. This follows social media calls to boycott Israeli-owned businesses and protests against Israel. Authorities have set up a hotline and are coordinating efforts to ensure the safety of visitors.

title: Ivanka takes daughter to Taylor Swift concert despite Trump's 'hate' for 'childless cat lady'
content: Ivanka Trump took her daughter Arabella to a Taylor Swift concert in Miami. This was surprising because Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris against Donald Trump. Despite political differences, Ivanka wanted to make sure her daughter's admiration for the singer remained unaffected. A plane with a banner mocking Taylor's political stance also appeared at the event.
summary: Ivanka Trump took her daughter Arabella to a Taylor Swift concert in Miami. This was surprising because Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris against Donald Trump. Despite political differences, Ivanka wanted to make sure her daughter's admiration for the singer remained unaffected. A plane with a banner mocking Taylor's political stance also appeared at the event.

title: Hong Kong bars services like WhatsApp and Google Drive from govt computers
content: The Hong Kong government bans most civil servants from using apps like WhatsApp and Google Drive on work computers citing security risks. Workers can still use these services on personal devices at work. The measure is to combat data leaks and hacking, with possibilities for exceptions with manager approval.
summary: The Hong Kong government bans most civil servants from using apps like WhatsApp and Google Drive on work computers citing security risks. Workers can still use these services on personal devices at work. The measure is to combat data leaks and hacking, with possibilities for exceptions with manager approval.

title: Tropical storm Trami triggers heavy rains and flooding in eastern Philippines
content: Heavy rains from tropical storm Trami caused severe flooding in eastern Philippines, leading to rescues from rooftops. With storm warnings issued and thousands in emergency shelters, President Marcos Jr. canceled appointments to oversee relief efforts. Many areas face rescue boat shortages, while school and office closures have been enforced across Luzon Island.
summary: Heavy rains from tropical storm Trami caused severe flooding in eastern Philippines, leading to rescues from rooftops. With storm warnings issued and thousands in emergency shelters, President Marcos Jr. canceled appointments to oversee relief efforts. Many areas face rescue boat shortages, while school and office closures have been enforced across Luzon Island.

title: Putin welcomes PM Modi and Xi Jinping to Russia for Brics Summit
Watch: New Zealand cops show off Bhangra moves in uniform on Auckland streets ahead of Diwali
content: New Zealand police officers celebrated Diwali by performing the traditional Punjabi dance, Bhangra, in their uniforms, delighting the community with lively moves under colorful lights. The viral video showcased cultural exchange and harmony, garnering positive reactions from viewers who praised the openness to embracing different cultures and races.
summary: New Zealand police officers celebrated Diwali by performing the traditional Punjabi dance, Bhangra, in their uniforms, delighting the community with lively moves under colorful lights. The viral video showcased cultural exchange and harmony, garnering positive reactions from viewers who praised the openness to embracing different cultures and races.

title: Mexico shootout: 19 gang members dead in Sinaloa, local cartel leader arrested
content: A shootout near Culiacan, Sinaloa, killed 19 suspected gang members, with a local cartel leader arrested. Over 30 gunmen attacked soldiers, leading to a deadly exchange. Edwin Antonio 'N', linked to the Sinaloa Cartel, was detained. The incident intensified violence since the arrest of cartel co-founder 'El Mayo' Zambada in July.
summary: A shootout near Culiacan, Sinaloa, killed 19 suspected gang members, with a local cartel leader arrested. Over 30 gunmen attacked soldiers, leading to a deadly exchange. Edwin Antonio 'N', linked to the Sinaloa Cartel, was detained. The incident intensified violence since the arrest of cartel co-founder 'El Mayo' Zambada in July.

title: ‘Spotlight is on us’: Eminem introduces Obama at Detroit event
content: Eminem energized supporters at a Detroit rally for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, highlighting the importance of free speech. The event featured speeches by Barack Obama and Michigan officials, aiming to bolster support ahead of the election. Eminem has consistently backed the Democratic Party.
summary: Eminem energized supporters at a Detroit rally for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, highlighting the importance of free speech. The event featured speeches by Barack Obama and Michigan officials, aiming to bolster support ahead of the election. Eminem has consistently backed the Democratic Party.

title: '...She didn’t pretend to work at McDonalds when it was closed': Obama takes a dig at Trump
content: Former President Obama and rapper Eminem endorsed Kamala Harris in Detroit. Obama highlighted Harris's middle-class background and genuine work experience at McDonald's. He contrasted this with Trump's staged McDonald's appearance. Eminem, a Detroit native and Trump critic, supported Harris to galvanize local voters and emphasize her readiness for the presidency.
summary: Former President Obama and rapper Eminem endorsed Kamala Harris in Detroit. Obama highlighted Harris's middle-class background and genuine work experience at McDonald's. He contrasted this with Trump's staged McDonald's appearance. Eminem, a Detroit native and Trump critic, supported Harris to galvanize local voters and emphasize her readiness for the presidency.

title: Trump campaign accuses UK’s Labour Party of 'interference' in US election
content: Donald Trump's campaign files an FEC complaint accusing the UK's Labour Party of interfering in the US election by sending members to aid Kamala Harris. The complaint cites potential illegal foreign contributions despite current rules allowing volunteering but not compensated or directed efforts.
summary: Donald Trump's campaign files an FEC complaint accusing the UK's Labour Party of interfering in the US election by sending members to aid Kamala Harris. The complaint cites potential illegal foreign contributions despite current rules allowing volunteering but not compensated or directed efforts.
